author: Staff Reporter
text:
The District Consumer Redressal Forum slapped a fine of Rs.40,000 on the Nilakottai branch of State Bank of India for deficiency in service here on Tuesday.

The petitioner, Kulapathi Devi, of Chinna Koothampatti, had deposited a cheque for Rs.6,000 offered to her under State government’s maternity scheme in 2010 in her savings account in the branch.

The amount was not credited to her account even after two months.

When she contacted the branch, the staff gave evasive replies and made her to run from pillar to post to get further details.

Later, the bank staff informed her that the cheque was missing.

In 2011, she filed a petition with the DDCRF seeking remedy.

Mental agony

After hearing her petition, the DDCRF Chairman, Iyappan, and members Meenambikai and Sheik Abdullah directed the bank branch to pay a compensation of Rs.40,000 for mental agony.
title: Bank branch fined
